sect2.title: Introduction to Enscript
sect2.para: Enscript converts ASCII text files to PostScript, HTML, RTF, ANSI and overstrikes.

sect2.title: Installation of Enscript
sect2.para: Install Enscript by running the following commands:

sect2.title: Command explanations
sect2.para: --sysconfdir=/etc/enscript: This switch puts configuration data in /etc/enscript instead of /usr/etc.
--localstatedir=/var: This switch sets the directory for runtime data to /var instead of /usr/var.
--with-media=Letter: This switch sets the medium format to letter.

sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The Enscript package contains diffpp, enscript, mkafmmap, over, sliceprint, states and filter data.

sect3.title: diffpp
sect3.para: diffpp converts diff output files to a format suitable to be printed with enscript.

sect3.title: enscript
sect3.para: enscript is a filter, used primarily by printing scripts, that converts ASCII text files to PostScript, HTML, RTF, ANSI and overstrikes.

sect3.title: mkafmmap
sect3.para: mkafmmap creates a font map from a given file.

sect3.title: over
sect3.para: over is a script which calls enscript and passes the correct parameters to create overstriked fonts.

sect3.title: sliceprint
sect3.para: sliceprint slices documents with long lines.

sect3.title: states
sect3.para: states is an awk-like text processing tool with some state machine extensions. It is designed for program source code highlighting and for similar tasks where state information helps input processing.
